newsitem.title: GERMANY: Lufthansa says has no plans to stop Tehran flight.
newsitem.headline: Lufthansa says has no plans to stop Tehran flight.

text.p: Germany's Deutsche Lufthansa AG said on Monday it had no plans to suspend flights to Iran despite rising tensions between Tehran and Bonn after a Berlin court last week implicated Iranian leaders in political assassinations.
"At the moment, we have no intentions to change our schedule," a Lufthansa spokesman told Reuters in response to an enquiry.
Lufthansa operates a flight from Frankfurt to Tehran on Sunday, Wednesday, Friday and Saturday with return service.
Bonn made clear at the weekend it would seek to avoid stoking a row with Iran over the court ruling despite a march on its embassy on Sunday by hundreds of thousands of Iranians.

European Union nations, with the exception of Greece, have recalled their ambassadors from Tehran after a German court on Thursday ruled Iran had ordered the 1992 murders of four Kurdish dissidents in Berlin.
Iran on Sunday responded to the withdrawal by announcing it would pull its envoys out of those countries in return.
The German foreign ministry, however, said on Sunday it still planned to reopen the embassy, closed since before Thursday's court ruling, on Monday.
